title: Revelation Chapter 11 Quiz - Multi-Level
description: An enhanced quiz on Revelation chapter 11 with Easy, Medium, Hard, and Theological levels. Each level has 15 carefully crafted questions. Choose your difficulty and dive in!

easy.title: Revelation Chapter 11 Quiz - Easy Level
easy.description: Perfect for beginners! Test your basic knowledge of Revelation Chapter 11.

questions.question: What was given to measure the temple of God in Revelation 11:1?
options: A reed like unto a rod
A golden crown
A silver trumpet
A scroll
questions.correctAnswer: A reed like unto a rod
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:1 states that a reed like unto a rod was given to measure the temple of God.

questions.question: According to Revelation 11:2, who is given the court without the temple?
options: The Gentiles
The Israelites
The two witnesses
The angels
questions.correctAnswer: The Gentiles
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:2 says the court without the temple is given unto the Gentiles.

questions.question: For how many days shall the two witnesses prophesy according to Revelation 11:3?
options: One thousand two hundred and threescore days
Forty and two months
Seven years
Three and a half days
questions.correctAnswer: One thousand two hundred and threescore days
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:3 specifies that the two witnesses shall prophesy for 1,260 days, which is one thousand two hundred and threescore days.

questions.question: Who are described as the two olive trees and two candlesticks standing before God?
options: The two witnesses
The four and twenty elders
The seven angels
The beast from the bottomless pit
questions.correctAnswer: The two witnesses
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:4 calls the two witnesses the two olive trees and two candlesticks standing before God.

questions.question: What power do the two witnesses have when someone tries to hurt them, according to Revelation 11:5?
options: Fire proceeds out of their mouth and devours their enemies
They call down lightning from heaven
They turn water into wine
They become invisible
questions.correctAnswer: Fire proceeds out of their mouth and devours their enemies
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:5 states that fire proceeds out of their mouth and devoureth their enemies if anyone tries to hurt them.

questions.question: What can the two witnesses do to heaven in the days of their prophecy, according to Revelation 11:6?
options: Shut heaven so it does not rain
Make the sun darken
Call down hail and fire
Open the gates of heaven
questions.correctAnswer: Shut heaven so it does not rain
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:6 explains that the two witnesses have power to shut heaven that it rain not during their prophecy.

questions.question: Who makes war against the two witnesses and kills them, as described in Revelation 11:7?
options: The beast that ascendeth out of the bottomless pit
The four and twenty elders
The angel of the Lord
The dragon
questions.correctAnswer: The beast that ascendeth out of the bottomless pit
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:7 mentions that the beast from the bottomless pit makes war against and kills the two witnesses.

questions.question: Where do the dead bodies of the two witnesses lie, according to Revelation 11:8?
options: In the street of the great city called Sodom and Egypt
In the temple courtyard
In the wilderness
On Mount Zion
questions.correctAnswer: In the street of the great city called Sodom and Egypt
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:8 states their dead bodies lie in the street of the great city spiritually called Sodom and Egypt.

questions.question: How long do people see the dead bodies of the two witnesses, as stated in Revelation 11:9?
options: Three days and a half
Seven days
Forty days
One day
questions.correctAnswer: Three days and a half
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:9 says their dead bodies are seen for three days and a half and are not allowed to be buried.

questions.question: What happens after three days and a half to the two witnesses in Revelation 11:11?
options: The Spirit of life from God enters them and they stand on their feet
They are buried by the people
They ascend directly to heaven
They disappear
questions.correctAnswer: The Spirit of life from God enters them and they stand on their feet
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:11 states after three days and a half, the Spirit of life from God enters them and they stand up.

questions.question: True or False: According to Revelation 11:13, a great earthquake causes the entire city to fall.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:13 says a tenth part of the city fell in the earthquake, not the entire city.

questions.question: True or False: Revelation 11:15 declares that the kingdoms of this world have become the kingdoms of the Lord and His Christ.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:15 states that the kingdoms of this world have become the kingdoms of the Lord and His Christ.

questions.question: True or False: The four and twenty elders worship God by standing on their feet as per Revelation 11:16.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: False
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:16 says the four and twenty elders fell upon their faces to worship God, not standing.

questions.question: Complete the verse: 'We give thee thanks, O Lord God Almighty, which art _______, and wast _______, and art to come' (Revelation 11:17)
options: and art, and wast
art, and wast
art, and wast, and art
art, and wast, and art to come
questions.correctAnswer: art, and wast, and art to come
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:17 includes the phrase 'which art, and wast, and art to come' praising God's eternal nature.

questions.question: What was seen in the temple of God in heaven according to Revelation 11:19?
options: The ark of his testament
The throne of God
The golden altar
The lamb with seven eyes
questions.correctAnswer: The ark of his testament
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:19 says the ark of his testament was seen in the temple of God in heaven.

medium.title: Revelation Chapter 11 Quiz - Medium Level
medium.description: Ready for more? Apply biblical truths from Revelation Chapter 11 to real-life situations.

questions.question: A fellow believer is discouraged by opposition while witnessing for Christ. Based on Revelation 11:3-6, what biblical truth would you share about perseverance in evangelism?
options: God empowers His witnesses with spiritual authority and protection
Believers should avoid confrontation to stay safe
Evangelism will always be easy and without opposition
Only ordained pastors are called to prophesy and witness
questions.correctAnswer: God empowers His witnesses with spiritual authority and protection
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:3-6 shows that God gives power to His two witnesses to prophesy, perform miracles, and defend themselves, teaching us to trust God's provision and protection in witness work.

questions.question: How does Revelation 11:1-2 encourage believers to maintain holiness and focus in their worship and service to God?
options: By measuring the temple and excluding the outer court given to Gentiles
By inviting everyone to worship regardless of their heart
By focusing on external rituals only
By ignoring the temple and focusing on personal gain
questions.correctAnswer: By measuring the temple and excluding the outer court given to Gentiles
questions.explanation: Verses 1-2 instruct measuring the temple and altar but excluding the outer court, symbolizing the importance of focusing on true worship and separating from influences that do not honor God.

questions.question: A believer struggles with fear during trials. According to Revelation 11:11-12, what hope can you give them about God's power over death?
options: God can restore life and bring victory even after apparent defeat
Death is the final end with no hope
Only miracles from humans can overcome death
Fear is a sign of weak faith that cannot be overcome
questions.correctAnswer: God can restore life and bring victory even after apparent defeat
questions.explanation: Verses 11-12 reveal that after three and a half days, God's Spirit revived the two witnesses, showing that God has power over death and can bring hope in trials.

questions.question: What does Revelation 11:15 teach about God’s eternal reign and how should that affect our daily work ethic?
options: God’s eternal reign assures us that our faithful work honors His kingdom
Our work is only important if it brings us wealth
God’s reign is temporary, so we focus on earthly success
Work is worthless because only salvation matters
questions.correctAnswer: God’s eternal reign assures us that our faithful work honors His kingdom
questions.explanation: Verse 15 proclaims God’s eternal kingdom, reminding believers to work with integrity and faithfulness as part of His everlasting rule (see verses 15, 17, 18).

questions.question: A Christian parent wants to teach their children about standing firm in faith. How does the example of the two witnesses in Revelation 11:3-7 encourage perseverance?
options: They prophesied faithfully despite threats and even death
They avoided danger by hiding
They relied on human strength alone
They gave up when opposition arose
questions.correctAnswer: They prophesied faithfully despite threats and even death
questions.explanation: The two witnesses prophesied for 1260 days, clothed in sackcloth, and faced death bravely (verses 3-7), teaching perseverance and reliance on God.

questions.question: How does Revelation 11:8-10 warn believers about the response of the world to faithful testimony, and what attitude should Christians maintain?
options: Believers should expect opposition but remain faithful and prayerful
Believers will always be celebrated by the world
Christians should avoid speaking out to stay popular
Revenge is justified against those who oppose faith
questions.correctAnswer: Believers should expect opposition but remain faithful and prayerful
questions.explanation: Verses 8-10 describe the rejection and celebration over the witnesses’ death, teaching that faithful witness may bring opposition but believers must continue trusting God.

questions.question: What does Revelation 11:19 teach about God’s presence and how should it inspire our worship and fellowship in the church?
options: God’s temple opened in heaven reveals His power and invites reverence and worship
God is distant and uninterested in our worship
Worship is optional and casual
Church fellowship is only for socializing
questions.correctAnswer: God’s temple opened in heaven reveals His power and invites reverence and worship
questions.explanation: Verse 19 shows God’s temple opened with awe-inspiring signs, reminding believers to worship with reverence and commit to genuine fellowship.

questions.question: True or False: According to Revelation 11:13, natural disasters like earthquakes can serve to remind people to glorify God.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:13 describes a great earthquake that caused fear and led people to give glory to God, showing that such events can prompt recognition of His sovereignty.

questions.question: True or False: Revelation 11:4 identifies the two witnesses as two olive trees and two candlesticks standing before God, symbolizing their divine appointment and spiritual fruitfulness.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Verse 4 describes the witnesses as olive trees and candlesticks, symbolizing God’s anointing and their role as His light-bearers.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: Revelation 11:18 teaches that the time has come for the dead to be _______, and for God to reward His servants and destroy those who destroy the earth.
options: judged
forgotten
saved
ignored
questions.correctAnswer: judged
questions.explanation: Verse 18 states it is the time for the dead to be judged, emphasizing accountability and God's justice.

questions.question: How does Revelation 11:16-17 model humility and gratitude in the life of a believer?
options: The elders fall on their faces and give thanks to God for His power and reign
The elders boast about their own achievements
Gratitude is only shown after personal success
Humility means withdrawing from worship
questions.correctAnswer: The elders fall on their faces and give thanks to God for His power and reign
questions.explanation: Verses 16-17 show the elders humbly worshiping and thanking God, teaching believers to express gratitude and humility before Him.

questions.question: A believer is tempted to despair because the wicked seem to prosper. How does Revelation 11:15-18 encourage perseverance and trust in God's justice?
options: God’s kingdom will reign forever and He will judge the dead and reward the faithful
The wicked will always win and God is powerless
Believers should give up since justice is delayed
Only worldly success matters
questions.correctAnswer: God’s kingdom will reign forever and He will judge the dead and reward the faithful
questions.explanation: Verses 15-18 affirm God's eternal reign and coming judgment, encouraging believers to trust His justice and remain steadfast.

questions.question: Based on Revelation 11:5-6, how can believers understand the role of spiritual authority in resisting temptation and trials?
options: Believers have power through God to resist and overcome difficulties miraculously
Spiritual authority is irrelevant in everyday struggles
Only physical weapons can defeat spiritual enemies
Believers should ignore spiritual warfare
questions.correctAnswer: Believers have power through God to resist and overcome difficulties miraculously
questions.explanation: Verses 5-6 describe the witnesses’ power to defend and perform miracles, teaching believers they are empowered by God to resist trials.

questions.question: How does the example of the two witnesses lying dead in the streets (Revelation 11:8-9) challenge believers to respond to rejection and suffering for their faith?
options: Believers should remain faithful even if rejected and misunderstood
Believers should avoid public witness to prevent suffering
Suffering means God has abandoned the believer
Revenge is the right response to rejection
questions.correctAnswer: Believers should remain faithful even if rejected and misunderstood
questions.explanation: Verses 8-9 illustrate the witnesses’ death and rejection, teaching believers to endure suffering for faith without losing hope.

questions.question: What lesson about spiritual vigilance and prayer can be learned from the measuring of the temple and altar in Revelation 11:1?
options: Believers must carefully guard their devotion and service to God
Measuring is a physical act with no spiritual meaning
Worship can be casual and careless
The temple is irrelevant today
questions.correctAnswer: Believers must carefully guard their devotion and service to God
questions.explanation: Verse 1’s measuring symbolizes careful attention to holiness and devotion, encouraging believers to be spiritually vigilant and disciplined.

hard.title: Revelation Chapter 11 Quiz - Hard Level
hard.description: Challenge yourself with deep analysis and cross-biblical connections from Revelation Chapter 11.

questions.question: What symbolic objects represent the two witnesses mentioned in Revelation 11, and what is their significance?
options: Two olive trees and two candlesticks, symbolizing God's anointed and His light-bearing witnesses
Two lions and two eagles, symbolizing strength and swiftness
Two mountains and two rivers, symbolizing stability and life
Two angels and two flames, symbolizing divine messengers and purification
questions.correctAnswer: Two olive trees and two candlesticks, symbolizing God's anointed and His light-bearing witnesses
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:4 calls the two witnesses 'two olive trees, and the two candlesticks standing before the God of the earth,' referencing Zechariah 4 and symbolizing anointed servants who provide spiritual light and sustenance.

questions.question: How long will the two witnesses prophesy, and what Old Testament prophetic period does this duration echo?
options: 1,260 days, paralleling the 42 months or 3.5 years often associated with prophetic periods in Daniel
7 years, reflecting the traditional tribulation period
40 days, similar to Moses on Mount Sinai
3 years, reminiscent of Elijah’s ministry
questions.correctAnswer: 1,260 days, paralleling the 42 months or 3.5 years often associated with prophetic periods in Daniel
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:3 states the witnesses will prophesy 1,260 days (or 42 months, as per verse 2), a period linked to apocalyptic prophecy in Daniel, symbolizing a divinely limited time of testimony and tribulation.

questions.question: What powers are given to the two witnesses to demonstrate their divine authority?
options: To shut heaven so it does not rain, turn waters to blood, and strike the earth with plagues
To part the seas, bring down fire from heaven, and raise the dead
To heal the sick, cast out demons, and speak in tongues
To control winds, stop the sun, and cause earthquakes
questions.correctAnswer: To shut heaven so it does not rain, turn waters to blood, and strike the earth with plagues
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:6 describes the witnesses’ powers, echoing Elijah’s and Moses’ miracles in the Old Testament, emphasizing their prophetic role and divine authority during their ministry.

questions.question: What happens to the two witnesses after they finish their testimony, and what does this foreshadow in biblical typology?
options: They are killed by the beast from the bottomless pit, foreshadowing martyrdom and resurrection
They ascend immediately to heaven, symbolizing reward without suffering
They are taken into captivity by the Gentiles, indicating exile
They disappear mysteriously, representing divine concealment
questions.correctAnswer: They are killed by the beast from the bottomless pit, foreshadowing martyrdom and resurrection
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:7 describes the beast overcoming and killing the witnesses, paralleling Christ’s death and resurrection and emphasizing themes of prophetic suffering and vindication.

questions.question: The dead bodies of the two witnesses lie in a city spiritually called what, and why is this significant historically and theologically?
options: Sodom and Egypt, symbolizing sinfulness and oppression where Christ was crucified
Babylon and Nineveh, representing judgment and repentance
Jerusalem and Rome, indicating centers of religious and imperial power
Golgotha and Bethlehem, sites associated with death and birth of Christ
questions.correctAnswer: Sodom and Egypt, symbolizing sinfulness and oppression where Christ was crucified
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:8 identifies the city as spiritually Sodom and Egypt, evoking biblical imagery of depravity and bondage, and historically linking to Jerusalem where Jesus was crucified, highlighting the rejection of God’s witnesses.

questions.question: For how many days do the people not allow the dead bodies of the witnesses to be buried, and what Old Testament event might this parallel?
options: Three and a half days, paralleling Jonah’s time in the fish and Christ’s resurrection period
Seven days, reflecting Jewish mourning customs
Forty days, reminiscent of Moses on Sinai
One day, signifying a single day of mourning
questions.correctAnswer: Three and a half days, paralleling Jonah’s time in the fish and Christ’s resurrection period
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:9 notes the bodies lie unburied for three and a half days, a symbolic timeframe connected to Jonah’s and Jesus’ time in death before resurrection, representing a period of divine judgment and hope.

questions.question: What is the reaction of those dwelling on the earth to the death of the two witnesses, and what does this reveal about the spiritual climate of the time?
options: They rejoice, make merry, and send gifts because the witnesses tormented them
They mourn and repent for rejecting God’s messengers
They remain indifferent, showing spiritual apathy
They rise up in rebellion against the beast
questions.correctAnswer: They rejoice, make merry, and send gifts because the witnesses tormented them
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:10 describes earthly inhabitants celebrating the death of the prophets, illustrating hostility toward divine truth and the prevalence of spiritual rebellion and wickedness.

questions.question: What event occurs after three and a half days that causes great fear among those who see it, and what theological theme does this illustrate?
options: The Spirit of life enters the witnesses and they stand, illustrating resurrection and divine vindication
A great earthquake destroys the city, illustrating divine judgment
The beast ascends to heaven, illustrating satanic deception
A new temple is built, illustrating restoration
questions.correctAnswer: The Spirit of life enters the witnesses and they stand, illustrating resurrection and divine vindication
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:11 recounts the resurrection of the witnesses by God’s Spirit, symbolizing victory over death and a powerful testimony to God’s sovereignty.

questions.question: Upon their resurrection, how do the two witnesses ascend to heaven, and what biblical imagery does this evoke?
options: They ascend in a cloud, evoking Old Testament theophanies and Christ’s ascension
They walk up a mountain, recalling Moses’ ascent
They are taken by a chariot of fire, reminiscent of Elijah
They disappear in a whirlwind, symbolizing divine mystery
questions.correctAnswer: They ascend in a cloud, evoking Old Testament theophanies and Christ’s ascension
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:12 states they ascend in a cloud, a symbol of divine presence used in Exodus, Elijah’s ascension, and Christ’s ascension, signifying God’s approval and heavenly authority.

questions.question: What natural disaster follows the ascension of the two witnesses, and how does this event affect the city and its inhabitants?
options: A great earthquake causes a tenth of the city to fall and kills 7,000 people, frightening the survivors into glorifying God
A massive flood destroys the city, symbolizing cleansing
A great fire consumes the city, representing judgment
A plague strikes the inhabitants, showing divine wrath
questions.correctAnswer: A great earthquake causes a tenth of the city to fall and kills 7,000 people, frightening the survivors into glorifying God
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:13 describes an earthquake killing many and causing fear, which leads survivors to glorify God, highlighting the theme of judgment and repentance following divine acts.

questions.question: What proclamation is made when the seventh angel sounds, and how does this reflect the eschatological hope in Revelation?
options: The kingdoms of the world become the kingdoms of the Lord and His Christ, who will reign forever
The final judgment begins, separating the righteous and the wicked
The new heaven and new earth are revealed
The temple is rebuilt in Jerusalem
questions.correctAnswer: The kingdoms of the world become the kingdoms of the Lord and His Christ, who will reign forever
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:15 proclaims divine sovereignty over all earthly kingdoms, emphasizing the ultimate triumph of Christ and eternal reign, a central eschatological theme.

questions.question: What is the response of the twenty-four elders upon the sounding of the seventh angel, and what does this signify in the heavenly court setting?
options: They fall on their faces and worship God, signifying reverence and submission
They sing a new song, celebrating victory
They cast crowns before the throne, symbolizing surrender
They debate the timing of judgment, showing divine deliberation
questions.correctAnswer: They fall on their faces and worship God, signifying reverence and submission
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:16 describes the elders’ worshipful posture, illustrating humility and honor in God’s heavenly court after the declaration of His eternal reign.

questions.question: According to Revelation 11, what reasons do the elders give for thanking God Almighty?
options: Because He was, is, and is to come; He has taken great power and begun to reign
Because He has forgiven sin and restored Israel
Because He has defeated the dragon and given peace
Because He has sent the Holy Spirit and established the church
questions.correctAnswer: Because He was, is, and is to come; He has taken great power and begun to reign
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:17 expresses the elders’ thanks to God for His eternal nature and the commencement of His sovereign reign, affirming His unchanging dominion.

questions.question: True or False: The temple of God is opened in heaven revealing the ark of His testament, accompanied by lightnings, voices, thunderings, an earthquake, and great hail.
options: True
False
questions.correctAnswer: True
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:19 describes the heavenly temple opening with dramatic signs, symbolizing divine presence and authority, confirming the statement as true.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: The holy city shall be ______ under foot forty and two months according to Revelation 11.
options: trodden
blessed
protected
hidden
questions.correctAnswer: trodden
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:2 states that the holy city will be 'trodden under foot forty and two months,' indicating a period of Gentile domination and oppression.

theological.title: Revelation Chapter 11 Quiz - Theological Level
theological.description: Deep biblical theology from Revelation Chapter 11 that unites all believers. Explore foundational truths about God, creation, and humanity.

questions.question: What was John instructed to measure in Revelation 11?
options: The temple of God, the altar, and those worshiping therein
The entire city and its walls
Only the altar and the ark of the covenant
The court outside the temple
questions.correctAnswer: The temple of God, the altar, and those worshiping therein
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:1 commands John to measure the temple of God, the altar, and those who worship there, signifying God's protection and ownership over His sanctuary and worshipers. This echoes Ezekiel 40:3-5, where a man measures the temple, and Psalm 48:1-2, which praises the city of God. It also aligns with the divine concern for worship in Exodus 25:22 and 1 Kings 8:15.

questions.question: According to Revelation 11, how long shall the holy city be trodden underfoot by the Gentiles?
options: Forty-two months
One thousand two hundred and sixty days
Seven years
Three and a half days
questions.correctAnswer: Forty-two months
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:2 states the holy city (Jerusalem) will be trampled by Gentiles for forty-two months, symbolizing a period of tribulation. This period is consistent with Daniel 7:25 and Daniel 12:7, which also describe a time of persecution. It reflects God's sovereign allowance of suffering before final deliverance, consistent with Romans 8:22-23 and 2 Thessalonians 2:3-4.

questions.question: Who are described as the two olive trees and two candlesticks standing before God in Revelation 11?
options: The two witnesses
The two angels guarding the temple
The two kingdoms of Israel and Judah
The two archangels Michael and Gabriel
questions.correctAnswer: The two witnesses
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:4 identifies the two witnesses as the two olive trees and two candlesticks, imagery drawing on Zechariah 4:3-14 where olive trees supply oil to lamps representing God's spirit and presence. They symbolize God's empowered testimony, similar to Zechariah's prophetic encouragement and the lampstand representing God's church in Exodus 25:31-40 and Hebrews 1:7.

questions.question: What powers are granted to the two witnesses in Revelation 11?
options: Power to shut heaven, turn waters to blood, and smite the earth with plagues
Power to heal the sick and raise the dead
Power to cast out demons and speak in tongues
Power to create and destroy worlds
questions.correctAnswer: Power to shut heaven, turn waters to blood, and smite the earth with plagues
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:6 outlines the specific powers of the witnesses, paralleling Elijah’s power to shut heaven (1 Kings 17:1) and Moses’ miracles turning water to blood and plagues (Exodus 7:17-21). This signifies divine authority over nature and judgment, consistent with God’s power revealed in Exodus 9:22-25 and Luke 4:18-19.

questions.question: What happens to the two witnesses after they finish their testimony?
options: They are killed by the beast from the bottomless pit
They ascend immediately to heaven
They are taken captive by the Gentiles
They disappear mysteriously
questions.correctAnswer: They are killed by the beast from the bottomless pit
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:7 describes how the beast from the bottomless pit makes war against the two witnesses and kills them, reflecting the spiritual opposition to God's prophets as seen in Daniel 7:21 and Matthew 23:37-39. Their death symbolizes the cost of faithful witness amid evil, consistent with John 15:20 and Acts 7:54-60.

questions.question: Where do the dead bodies of the two witnesses lie according to Revelation 11?
options: In the street of the great city, spiritually called Sodom and Egypt
In a tomb outside the city walls
In the temple courtyard
In the wilderness
questions.correctAnswer: In the street of the great city, spiritually called Sodom and Egypt
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:8 states the dead bodies lie in the street of the great city, figuratively called Sodom and Egypt, symbolizing moral corruption and oppression, paralleling Genesis 19:24-25 and Exodus 1:8-14. This emphasizes the spiritual judgment and rejection of God's witnesses, similar to Jesus’ crucifixion in Jerusalem (Luke 13:34) and the persistent hostility toward God's people.

questions.question: How long are the dead bodies of the two witnesses left exposed?
options: Three days and a half
Seven days
Forty-two months
One thousand two hundred and sixty days
questions.correctAnswer: Three days and a half
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:9 explains their bodies lie unburied for three and a half days, a symbolic period representing incomplete judgment and a time of waiting, paralleling Jesus’ resurrection after three days (Matthew 12:40) and the 1260 days mentioned in Daniel 12:7, signifying God's timing for vindication and resurrection.

questions.question: What is the reaction of those dwelling on the earth to the death of the two witnesses?
options: They rejoice and send gifts to one another
They mourn and repent
They ignore the event
They build a monument for them
questions.correctAnswer: They rejoice and send gifts to one another
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:10 shows that the earth's inhabitants rejoice over the death of the witnesses, revealing the hostility toward God's truth and the celebration of perceived victory over righteousness, consistent with Psalm 2:1-3 and Matthew 27:15-26 where crowds reject God's messengers and Christ.

questions.question: What event occurs after three and a half days following the death of the two witnesses?
options: The Spirit of life from God enters them and they stand on their feet
They remain dead and are buried
They are resurrected but do not ascend to heaven
Their bodies disappear mysteriously
questions.correctAnswer: The Spirit of life from God enters them and they stand on their feet
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:11 describes the resurrection of the two witnesses by the Spirit of life from God, affirming divine power over death, similar to Jesus’ resurrection (Romans 8:11), Ezekiel’s dry bones (Ezekiel 37:1-14), and resurrection hope in 1 Corinthians 15:52-54.

questions.question: What happens immediately after the two witnesses ascend to heaven?
options: A great earthquake occurs, a tenth of the city falls, and seven thousand men are killed
The sun is darkened and the moon turns to blood
A great famine begins
The temple is destroyed
questions.correctAnswer: A great earthquake occurs, a tenth of the city falls, and seven thousand men are killed
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:13 records a great earthquake and destruction following the witnesses’ ascension, reminiscent of Old Testament judgments (Exodus 19:18, Psalm 18:7) and apocalyptic imagery in Joel 2:10 and Matthew 27:51-54, indicating God's sovereign judgment and stirring repentance.

questions.question: What proclamation is made when the seventh angel sounds in Revelation 11?
options: The kingdoms of this world have become the kingdoms of our Lord and of His Christ
The end of the world has come
The temple is cleansed and restored
The dead will no longer be judged
questions.correctAnswer: The kingdoms of this world have become the kingdoms of our Lord and of His Christ
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:15 declares the eternal reign of Christ as the kingdoms of the world become His, fulfilling Daniel 7:14, Psalm 2:7-9, and 1 Corinthians 15:24-26, affirming Christ’s sovereign kingship and eschatological victory over all earthly powers.

questions.question: How do the twenty-four elders respond to the seventh angel's sounding?
options: They fall on their faces and worship God
They blow trumpets to announce victory
They weep for the destruction of the earth
They ascend to heaven
questions.correctAnswer: They fall on their faces and worship God
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:16 shows the elders worship God in response to His revealed power, consistent with worship scenes in Revelation 4:10, Isaiah 6:1-7, and Hebrews 12:28, highlighting the reverence due to God's eternal sovereignty and righteous judgment.

questions.question: What do the elders thank God for in their worship in Revelation 11?
options: For taking great power and reigning
For sending plagues upon the earth
For destroying the temple
For granting peace to the nations
questions.correctAnswer: For taking great power and reigning
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:17 expresses thanksgiving for God taking His great power and reigning, affirming His eternal existence and sovereignty, paralleling Exodus 15:18, Psalm 93:1, and 1 Timothy 6:15, emphasizing God’s lordship over history and eschatological fulfillment.

questions.question: What is said about the judgment and wrath of God in Revelation 11?
options: The nations are angry, and the time of the dead to be judged has come
God’s wrath will be withheld indefinitely
Only the living are judged
Wrath will be shown only to the saints
questions.correctAnswer: The nations are angry, and the time of the dead to be judged has come
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:18 reveals that God's wrath has come and the dead are to be judged, a key eschatological truth consistent with Acts 17:31, 2 Timothy 4:1, and Hebrews 9:27, emphasizing God's righteous judgment over all humanity and vindication of His servants.

questions.question: What was seen in the temple of God in heaven when it was opened in Revelation 11?
options: The ark of his testament, lightnings, voices, thunderings, earthquake, and great hail
The throne of God surrounded by angels
A lamb standing as though slain
A river of life flowing from the altar
questions.correctAnswer: The ark of his testament, lightnings, voices, thunderings, earthquake, and great hail
questions.explanation: Revelation 11:19 describes the heavenly temple opened revealing the ark of the covenant and accompanying awesome signs, echoing Exodus 25:22, Hebrews 9:4, and theophanies in Exodus 19:16-19, symbolizing God's covenant faithfulness and majestic presence.
